comments:
Description:
ClassCircularityError when preview report after deploy birt in Tomcat5.5.7.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Deploy birt in Tomcat5.5.7
2. Preview report.

Result:
See snapshot.
This issue in Tomcat 5.5.7 has gone in build 20060224, but remains in Weblogic8

I tried to change Time Zone to Greenwich mean time and redeployed build 20060224.
This time when preview index.jsp, I got:
Error 500--Internal Server Error 
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
	at com.ibm.icu.impl.ICUResourceBundle.findResourceWithFallback(ICUResourceBundle.java:1086)
	at com.ibm.icu.impl.ICUResourceBundle.getWithFallback(ICUResourceBundle.java:637)
	at com.ibm.icu.impl.CalendarData.get(CalendarData.java:51)
	at com.ibm.icu.util.Calendar.setWeekData(Calendar.java:3895)
	at com.ibm.icu.util.Calendar.(Calendar.java:1543)
	at com.ibm.icu.util.GregorianCalendar.(GregorianCalendar.java:391)
	at com.ibm.icu.util.GregorianCalendar.(GregorianCalendar.java:346)
	at com.ibm.icu.util.SimpleTimeZone.inDaylightTime(SimpleTimeZone.java:788)
	at com.ibm.icu.impl.TimeZoneAdapter.inDaylightTime(TimeZoneAdapter.java:119)
	at java.util.TimeZone.getOffsets(TimeZone.java:221)
	at java.util.GregorianCalendar.computeTime(GregorianCalendar.java:1681)
	at java.util.Calendar.updateTime(Calendar.java:1569)
	at java.util.Calendar.getTimeInMillis(Calendar.java:912)
	at java.util.Date.(Date.java:247)
	at java.util.zip.ZipEntry.dosToJavaTime(ZipEntry.java:290)
	at java.util.zip.ZipEntry.getTime(ZipEntry.java:129)
	at weblogic.utils.classloaders.ZipSource.lastModified(ZipSource.java:77)
	at weblogic.servlet.jsp.Jsp2Java.makeReader(Jsp2Java.java:263)
	at weblogic.servlet.jsp.Jsp2Java.outputs(Jsp2Java.java:124)
	at weblogic.utils.compiler.CodeGenerator.generate(CodeGenerator.java:258)
	at weblogic.servlet.jsp.JspStub.compilePage(JspStub.java:367)
	at weblogic.servlet.jsp.JspStub.prepareServlet(JspStub.java:223)
	at weblogic.servlet.jsp.JspStub.prepareServlet(JspStub.java:172)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletStubImpl.getServlet(ServletStubImpl.java:518)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletStubImpl.invokeServlet(ServletStubImpl.java:362)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletStubImpl.invokeServlet(ServletStubImpl.java:446)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletStubImpl.invokeServlet(ServletStubImpl.java:305)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.WebAppServletContext$ServletInvocationAction.run(WebAppServletContext.java:6350)
	at weblogic.security.acl.internal.AuthenticatedSubject.doAs(AuthenticatedSubject.java:317)
	at weblogic.security.service.SecurityManager.runAs(SecurityManager.java:118)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.WebAppServletContext.invokeServlet(WebAppServletContext.java:3635)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.ServletRequestImpl.execute(ServletRequestImpl.java:2585)
	at weblogic.kernel.ExecuteThread.execute(ExecuteThread.java:197)

Using the build \\kerman\BIRT_Build\release2package\20060222, adding 2 logging jars, not adding icu4j.jar, deploy the war with weblogic 8.1, viewer works fine.

Need qa to confirm this.

This is a icu4j bug. Check:

http://dev.icu-project.org/cgi-bin/icu-bugs/config_build?id=4560;expression=weblogic;user=guest
http://dev.icu-project.org/cgi-bin/icu-bugs?findid=4346&go=Go

Workaround:

Extarct icu4j.jar into web-inf/classes/ remove jar from web-inf/lib, using folder deployment, viewer can work.

Need to trace the latest icu4j release to see whether this issue gone or not.
eclipse 3.2 m5a still use icu4j.jar v3.4.2. The issue should still be there. Obviously this issue can not be resolved in m5.

bug has been logged with icu4j to trace this issue.

See:
http://dev.icu-project.org/cgi-bin/icu-bugs/incoming?findid=5089

Update the Tomcat plugin to 5.5.15, plugin found at http://www.sourceforge.net/projects/eclipsehelp.

Look at the .log found in the ${WORKSPACE_LOC}\.metadata\plugins\org.apache.tomcat
Use Weblogic 9 to deploy should no such excpetion.
